Reviews.Title: “A Comforting Place When It Is Needed the Most”
Reviews.Author: woody2762
Reviews.Content: Located on the St. Vincent Hospital campus, this was the obvious choice when I needed to be close to my daughter who was a patient at St. Vincent. The staff is incredibly courteous and helpful. The rooms are large and I had a small refrigerator and a microwave that came in handy for my extended stay. I didn't have a chance to eat at the 1881 restaurant as I spent the majority of my time at the hospital. I highly recommend this hotel if you need to be close to St Vincent's Hospital on 86th.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: A A
Reviews.Content: We used the Marten House Hotel and Conference Center for an event and the service we received was well below par. In addition the carpets were stained in the room we used and the chairs were in poor condition. No one was there to greet us or show us to the room or answer questions when we arrived and to top it all off they severely and wrongly overcharged us. Frustrating to say the least, we will never return and will make sure others know of our dissatisfaction as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: alliswell252
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the campus of St. Vincent's Medical Center and is uniquely situated for anyone visiting the hospital (there is a shuttle from the hotel to the hospital). Marten House is very reasonably priced and as a result there aren't some perks a traveler might expect (shampoo comes in a packet) but my room had a refrigerator and coffee maker and a huge bed. The exercise room was better than I expected and should be acceptable to anyone who needs a quick workout during a stay. At least during the week, the restaurant closes at 9 pm, which was a bit too early for me during my stay. My room was clean and quiet and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who needs a hotel close to St. Vincent's.

Reviews.Title: “Attended a conference”
Reviews.Author: babina8
Reviews.Content: I attended a 2-day conference in November 2010 at this hotel. I didn't stay at the hotel, but I tried to -- it was completely booked when I checked about a month before the conference. I really wish I had been able to stay there, as it looked better than where I ended up finding a room, and it would have been extremely convenient. The conference center was very nice -- well equipped, updated, comfortable. No true meals were provided, but they did provide a small continental breakfast and snacks at breaks, which were fine -- not amazing, but I'd say a little better than expected at conferences. I'd definitely attend another conference here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: wsa46041
Reviews.Content: This was a horrible experience. The hotel is old and run down, management and front desk associates are ignorant and have no clue what is going on. Pool in very poorly maintained. Have to pay 75 cents just to make a local call (how stupid is that), also $6.95/24hrs for wireless internet that is as slow as a turtle. Took me 5 minutes to get onto MSN and Yahoo, as well as another 5 minutes just to read an email. Do not stay here.... Drive down the road....

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE AND OLD”
Reviews.Author: visit08
Reviews.Content: TERRIBLE !! I reserved two rooms for four nights. My husband was having surgery at St. Vincent's. The rooms were clean but so old. The rooms didn't have a desk or any other frills. The beds were awfull!! They were not very friendly. After the first night they rented out one of the rooms that I had reserved for my family. They did give us another room, but would not do an adjustment for the inconvenience. I will not stay at The Marten House again. They should build a new Marten House. It is just to old, old, old!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP (but NICE) hotel close to BROAD RIPPLE !!”
Reviews.Author: Driver8rws
Reviews.Content: 4 of us were in town for the Broad Ripple Brew Fest in late July and we needed a hotel that was CHEAP (but nice) and CLOSE to Broad Ripple... THIS IS IT !! Only 4.5mi from Broad Ripple and only $54 on HOTELS.com !!!!!!!!!!! The room was JUST as nice as many $100 rooms that I have stayed in. PERFECTLY FINE HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Needs freshen up”
Reviews.Author: mctavish1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights for the F1 Grandprix,thought that the rooms were dark and dull.Beds were well used and not very comfortable,there was olso a damp smell from the carpets.Moved to another hotel (La Quinta airport) out of the darkness and into the light !! Would not recommend the Marten House, better hotels and rates elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel With A Heart”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not your typical weekend getaway hotel. So, if that's what you're looking for, you need to head downtown. It may not be perfect like others have explained but the Marten House does care about their guests. Let me explain... If you're from Indiana, like myself, and have ever had a family member sent to St. Vincent Hospital (which is across the street from the hotel) to have open heart surgery, you have probably stayed at the Marten House. The Marten House offers family members a very good rate (if not free) to those who have family members who are having or had surgery. Most recently, a friend of mine had a premature baby and the Marten House is offering the parents 2 free nights a week until the baby is released to go home. It allows the family to be close by instead of having to commute each day, over 80 miles each way in this instance. I just really appreciate the service that's offered to the family members of those who are in the hospital.

HotelInfo.Name: The Marten House Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1801 W. 86th St, Indianapolis, IN 46260
